snippet: After Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton’s trip failed to get deals on two big items, Beijing and Washington have a long way to go to translate soothing rhetoric into action.
abstract: Editorial expresses disappointment that Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton was unable to accomplish two major objectives during her fifth state visit to China--defusing tensions in the South China Sea and ending Pres Bashar al-Assad's violent rampage in Syria; argues that Chinese stubbornness has been key in prolonging the Syrian conflict.
lead_paragraph: After Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton’s trip failed to get deals on two big items, Beijing and Washington have a long way to go to translate soothing rhetoric into action.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
